channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024060890
item.description:
Report X-2024060890

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a Fedex envelope was found smoking on a slide. A spill agent was called the smoke stopped before the agent arrived. While investigating the shipment the agent discovered two sealed lead acid batteries non-spillable inside. The batteries were packed in fiberboard boxes in the envelope. One of the batteries had burn marks inside of the fiberboard box. The package didn't have any DG markings, paperwork attached also there was no shipping label on the outer packaging. The shipment is being held at the MEMH location.

item.title: Report X-2024060780
item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A metal drum was dropped during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The drum was dented and the bottom chime was damaged causing a release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024060779

The contents of the fiberboard box was a single glass bottle which was broken spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024060464
item.description:
Report X-2024060464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLYEE DISCOVERED THE OPEN BOX ITS CONTENTS ON THE BELT LEADING TO PD 2. HE STOPPED THE PROGRESS OF THE PACKAGE AND PLACED THEM ONT THE MISSORT CHUTE. DISCOVERED THAT ONE OF THE BOTTLES WAS LEAKING. HE CALLED FOR A RESPONDER SOON AFTER DISCOVERY. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. ONE PIECE OF TAPE WAS USED TO SECURE THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE, IT FAILED TO HOLD. THE CONTENTS FELL OUT THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE.

item.title: Report E-2024060044
item.description:
Report E-2024060044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 30, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2014 was punctured due to an unknown cause and released approximately 50-gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt/gravel below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel performed a tote transfer and labeled the tote for onsite disposal. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the released product. All waste was containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024051716
item.description:
Report X-2024051716

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of a release during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained five metal cans some with positive closure rings and packaged in plastic bags. The lid came off of on can causing a release inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024060206
item.description:
Report X-2024060206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No spill. Undeclared hazmat (no DOT labels or markings on outer packaging). Outer packaging: Torn, opaque, plastic envelope/bag. Inner packaging: 25lb plastic UNPOP Y rated drum of Heze Huayi Chem Co C3 Chlorinating Tablets. No damage to content; outer bag is fully torn. Recommend no bag/envelope as the inner drum is pre-printed with a LQ label. PLEASE NOTE: DGNAV Incident 9490 is the same but was found without a barcode or outer packaging.

  • Description: Spill. Hazmat shipped as fully regulated. Leaking UNPOP Y fiberboard box. One of two 1 gallon plastic bottles of SSDC Paramount Machine Dishwash, No. 1111955 lost 3oz of fluid from a loose cap closure.
